title: Currant Mountain
text: Currant Mountain is the highest <a href="mountain">mountain</a> in the <a href="White%20Pine%20Range">White Pine Range</a> in <a href="White%20Pine%20County%2C%20Nevada">White Pine County</a>, <a href="Nevada">Nevada</a>, United States. It is the twenty-first-highest mountain in the state, and also ranks as the sixteenth-most <a href="topographic%20prominence">topographically prominent</a> peak in the state. Its summit consists of a series of three spires on a thin limestone ridge, with the southern spire being the highest at . To the west are the <a href="Duckwater%2C%20Nevada">Duckwater</a> (<a href="Shoshone">Shoshone</a>) tribal lands and the northern arm of large <a href="Railroad%20Valley">Railroad Valley</a>. To the east is the northern part of <a href="White%20River%20%28Nevada%29">White River Valley</a>. The peak is located about southwest of the community of <a href="Ely%2C%20Nevada">Ely</a> near the <a href="Nye%20County%2C%20Nevada">Nye County</a> border, within the <a href="Currant%20Mountain%20Wilderness">Currant Mountain Wilderness</a> of the <a href="Humboldt-Toiyabe%20National%20Forest">Humboldt-Toiyabe National Forest</a>.
